title: Keep Feelin' FASCINATION
body_text:
MAIN EVENT: The
ECDDraft
"Unpredictable" was the most accurate word to describe the opening moments of this 6th birthday classic. For just the 7th time in
ECD
history - and the first since October 2008 - the dreaded
ECDDraft
reemerged, splitting the warriors of the famed game into two formidable armies.
The draft consisted of 17 total combatants, with three additional - Diana DiBuccio, Justin Pierce, and Juan Londono - added to the mix upon their arrivals during ANNIVERSARY 6.
After the conclusion of Game 5, a secret trade was made which saw Justin Wolf and Chris Burke switch teams; a first-time occurrence for the
Draft
.
The end result witnessed a crushing 7 to 1 defeat of the second squad [on the bottom]. Never before had an
ECDDraft
produced such a massacre.
SECONDARY CONTEST: The "MoneyMaker"
Rimshot Contest
Newcomer
Kayla Knott
made monumental history when she bested 9 top competitors for the coveted
Rimshot Contest
crown in her debut event. The array of talent, albeit unsuccessful, was a "who's who" list of highly-ranked participants: Kevin Megill, Gary Dietrich, Kenny Jacobs, Melissa Kerr, Joanice Lima, Justin Wolf, former one-time winner John Tronolone, former two-time winner Chris Adams, and defending, one-time champion Lauren Stopa.
This was the 16th overall
Rimshot Contest
, and the 3rd to feature the "MoneyMaker" stipulation. As per the pregame agreement, Kayla walked away with 50% of profits ($10) while the other will be put towards the purchase of brand new dodge balls.
SPECIAL ATTRACTION:
ECDElite
Induction
Justin Wolf
was announced as the 14th member of the prestigious
ECDElite
Hall of Fame. Having debuted in the autumn of 2006, he became the highest numbered player - 203 - to receive the honor.
JUSTIN WOLF
♦
Player Profile
: Born June 23, 1985; Debut DODGEBALL LVII (57) on September 23, 2006; 73 events participated; right-handed
♦
Career Highlights
: 1x Season Finale headliner; 1x Holiday Special headliner, 1x
Battle Royal
Champion
♦
Awards & Accolades
: 2010 "Deflection Defense"; 2008 "Rivalry of the Year" Finalist
(vs. Juan Londono)
; 2007 "Rookie of the Year" Finalist
♦
Major Contributions
: assisted in creation of current team regeneration targets; put together several musical soundtracks; brought food, drinks, and stereo system to various events; purchased many dodge balls
Special thanks to Rob Knott for once again capturing the video.
INJURIES
Unofficial reports claim that Sascha "Breakdancin'" Basista may have suffered the sport's plaguing broken finger injury. The former FAMILY AFFAIR 2010 headliner exited ANNIVERSARY 6 rather early, citing the unfortunate incident as reason for his sudden departure. The
ECD
community certainly hopes that no serious damage has been caused to the wily veteran.
RECORDS
Twenty (20) people participated in ANNIVERSARY 6, a turnout comprised of 15 men and 5 women. Two (2) new players were included in the night's attendance: Gary Dietrich and Kayla Knott.
Notable spectators included Cliff and Linda Gordon (longtime family friends of John Tronolone), friend-to-all Katie Grand, the energetic Logan Teielbaum (Jason Teitelbaum's dog), the delightful Janet Edwards (mother of Michael Edwards), and the one and only Gaile Adams (mother of Chris Adams).
ANNIVERSARY 6 was only the 5th
ECD
outing held on both the back and front sections of the Wall High School tennis courts. This was mainly due to the unusual light failure that persisted all throughout the extravaganza. As a result, the rarely-seen
Prison Ball
was instituted beginning with Game 4.
The official anthem was "Fascination" by The Human League. Soundtrack submissions were provided by Jason Teitelbaum, Lauren Stopa, Alison Bertsch, John Tronolone, Kelly Oberto, Rob Knott, and Diana DiBuccio.
Lastly, the preview for ANNIVERSARY 6 featured the first-time appearance of "The Writer", the sport's mysterious behind-the-scenes mastermind. The nearly two-minute video preview was a first for
ECD
.
NEXT EVENT: October 8, 2011 | 3pm - 7pm
SURPRISE!
body_html:
• MAIN EVENT: The ECDDraft
    "Unpredictable" was the most accurate word to describe the opening moments of this 6th birthday classic. For just the 7th time in ECD history - and the first since October 2008 - the dreaded ECDDraft reemerged, splitting the warriors of the famed game into two formidable armies.

    The draft consisted of 17 total combatants, with three additional - Diana DiBuccio, Justin Pierce, and Juan Londono - added to the mix upon their arrivals during ANNIVERSARY 6.

    After the conclusion of Game 5, a secret trade was made which saw Justin Wolf and Chris Burke switch teams; a first-time occurrence for the Draft.

    The end result witnessed a crushing 7 to 1 defeat of the second squad [on the bottom]. Never before had an ECDDraft produced such a massacre.

  • SECONDARY CONTEST: The "MoneyMaker" Rimshot Contest
    Newcomer Kayla Knott made monumental history when she bested 9 top competitors for the coveted Rimshot Contest crown in her debut event. The array of talent, albeit unsuccessful, was a "who's who" list of highly-ranked participants: Kevin Megill, Gary Dietrich, Kenny Jacobs, Melissa Kerr, Joanice Lima, Justin Wolf, former one-time winner John Tronolone, former two-time winner Chris Adams, and defending, one-time champion Lauren Stopa.

    This was the 16th overall Rimshot Contest, and the 3rd to feature the "MoneyMaker" stipulation. As per the pregame agreement, Kayla walked away with 50% of profits ($10) while the other will be put towards the purchase of brand new dodge balls.

  • SPECIAL ATTRACTION: ECDElite Induction
    Justin Wolf was announced as the 14th member of the prestigious ECDElite Hall of Fame. Having debuted in the autumn of 2006, he became the highest numbered player - 203 - to receive the honor.

    JUSTIN WOLF
    ♦ Player Profile: Born June 23, 1985; Debut DODGEBALL LVII (57) on September 23, 2006; 73 events participated; right-handed
    ♦ Career Highlights: 1x Season Finale headliner; 1x Holiday Special headliner, 1x Battle Royal Champion
    ♦ Awards & Accolades: 2010 "Deflection Defense"; 2008 "Rivalry of the Year" Finalist (vs. Juan Londono); 2007 "Rookie of the Year" Finalist
    ♦ Major Contributions: assisted in creation of current team regeneration targets; put together several musical soundtracks; brought food, drinks, and stereo system to various events; purchased many dodge balls


    Special thanks to Rob Knott for once again capturing the video.

  • INJURIES
    Unofficial reports claim that Sascha "Breakdancin'" Basista may have suffered the sport's plaguing broken finger injury. The former FAMILY AFFAIR 2010 headliner exited ANNIVERSARY 6 rather early, citing the unfortunate incident as reason for his sudden departure. The ECD community certainly hopes that no serious damage has been caused to the wily veteran.

  • RECORDS
    Twenty (20) people participated in ANNIVERSARY 6, a turnout comprised of 15 men and 5 women. Two (2) new players were included in the night's attendance: Gary Dietrich and Kayla Knott.

    Notable spectators included Cliff and Linda Gordon (longtime family friends of John Tronolone), friend-to-all Katie Grand, the energetic Logan Teielbaum (Jason Teitelbaum's dog), the delightful Janet Edwards (mother of Michael Edwards), and the one and only Gaile Adams (mother of Chris Adams).

    ANNIVERSARY 6 was only the 5th ECD outing held on both the back and front sections of the Wall High School tennis courts. This was mainly due to the unusual light failure that persisted all throughout the extravaganza. As a result, the rarely-seen Prison Ball was instituted beginning with Game 4.

    The official anthem was "Fascination" by The Human League. Soundtrack submissions were provided by Jason Teitelbaum, Lauren Stopa, Alison Bertsch, John Tronolone, Kelly Oberto, Rob Knott, and Diana DiBuccio.

    Lastly, the preview for ANNIVERSARY 6 featured the first-time appearance of "The Writer", the sport's mysterious behind-the-scenes mastermind. The nearly two-minute video preview was a first for ECD.

    NEXT EVENT: October 8, 2011 | 3pm - 7pm
    SURPRISE!
